definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
see 心臟雜音|心脏杂音[xin1 zang4 za2 yin1]

sentences.english: Signs include exercise intolerance, but often there is only a heart murmur.
sentences.chinese: 临床症状包括运动不耐，但大多数病例仅有心脏杂音。

sentences.english: Her physical examination was remarkable for bilateral crackles in the lung bases.
sentences.chinese: 体格检查在双肺底部可闻明显的杂音。

sentences.english: And the reason for that is feedback.
sentences.chinese: 主要理由是反馈杂音的存在。

sentences.english: Noise is definitely a positive in some ways.
sentences.chinese: 杂音当然在某些方面是积极的。

sentences.english: All the buzz lately is that the Obama administration is “antibusiness.
sentences.chinese: 最近所有的杂音是奥巴马政府“对企业持敌视态度”。

sentences.english: The typical sign was audible click and systolic murmur in cardiac apex.
sentences.chinese: 典型体征为心尖区闻及喀喇音和收缩期杂音。

sentences.english: The site is aflutter can be easily hear vascular murmurs.
sentences.chinese: 有震颤的部位可很容易听到血管杂音。

sentences.english: Your child's physician may have also heard a heart murmur during a physical examination.
sentences.chinese: 你孩子的医生在查体时可能也听到了心脏的杂音。

sentences.english: The noise is that which prevents you from living a simple and peaceful life.
sentences.chinese: 杂音就是那些阻止你过一段简单平和的生活的事物。

sentences.english: High frequency noise present on analogue magnetic tape recordings.
sentences.chinese: 模拟录音器普遍存在的背景杂音。

sentences.english: About a half of the patients had no heart murmurs.
sentences.chinese: 心脏杂音非本病特异体征，约半数患者无明显杂音。

sentences.english: About a half of the patients had no heart murmurs.
sentences.chinese: 心脏杂音非本病特异体征，约半数患者无明显杂音。

sentences.english: Have you ever had a murmur?
If the valve is leaking blood back into the atrium, a murmur or whooshing sound can often be heard.
sentences.chinese: 如果瓣膜处血液回流，医生通常就会听到心杂音。

sentences.english: All had cardiac murmur and seven had leukocytosis.
sentences.chinese: 他们的心脏都有杂音，七位患者血中白血球上升。
